texts.value: Transcription factor capable of interacting with purine rich repeats (GA repeats) (PubMed:8441384, PubMed:10675337, PubMed:8816484). Acts as a a master regulator of nuclear-encoded mitochondrial genes (By similarity)
(Microbial infection) Necessary for the expression of the Adenovirus E4 gene
Heterotetramer of two alpha and two beta subunits (PubMed:7799916). Interacts with HCFC1, causing repression of transcriptional activity (PubMed:10675337)
Acetylated by EP300/p300. Deacetylated by SIRT7, promoting heterotetramerization and activity

features.description: in a colorectal cancer sample; somatic mutation
Minor reduction in transcriptional activation; when associated with A-295 or A-305 and A-306.
Minor effect upon interaction with HCFC1 and transcriptional activation. Loss of activity; when associated with A-297; A-298 and A-299, or with A-307 and A-310.
Minor reduction in transcriptional activation. Moderate reduction in activity; when associated with A-305 and A-306.
Strongly reduces interaction with HCFC1 and transcriptional activation. Loss of activity; when associated with A-297; A-298 and A-299, or with A-307 and A-310.
No effect on transcriptional activation. Minor reduction in activity; when associated with A-270 and A-271.
Strongly reduces interaction with HCFC1 and transcriptional activation. Loss of activity; when associated with A-264 and A-265, or A-273 and A-275.
Minor reduction in transcriptional activation. Moderate reduction in activity; when associated with A-270 and A-271.
Moderately reduces interaction with HCFC1 and transcriptional activation. Loss of activity; when associated with A-273 and A-275.

citation.title: cDNA cloning of transcription factor E4TF1 subunits with Ets and notch motifs.

Identity of GABP with NRF-2, a multisubunit activator of cytochrome oxidase expression, reveals a cellular role for an ETS domain activator of viral promoters.
Nuclear respiratory factors 1 and 2 utilize similar glutamine-containing clusters of hydrophobic residues to activate transcription.
The novel coactivator C1 (HCF) coordinates multiprotein enhancer formation and mediates transcription activation by GABP.
Initial characterization of the human central proteome.
